newsitem.title: JAPAN: Godo Steel in deal with regional rod maker.
newsitem.headline: Godo Steel in deal with regional rod maker.

text.p: Godo Steel Ltd said on Thursday it agreed to tie up with Nakayama Steel Products Co Ltd, an Osaka-area steel rod manufacturer, to produce and distribute steel rods.
Godo said the two companies formed the alliance, scheduled to last three years from January 1, in order to boost competitiveness by cutting distribution and production costs.
"We hope the tie-up will help improve our profits in or after 1997/98," a Godo spokesman said.

Godo Steel, owned 9.9 percent by Nippon Steel Corp, posted a parent current loss of 4.88 billion yen in the year to March 1996, on sales of 86.24 billion yen, due to weaker market prices for steel rods. It has forecast a current profit of 1.4 billion yen for 1996/97.
